title: Interim Customer Support Representative
description:
We’re seeking an Interim Customer Support Representative who is customer-centric, proactive, and eager to jump in and get work done. You’ll resolve customer inquiries via email, chat, and phone, and manage urgent or complex cases through our helpdesk software. In this interim role, you’ll act as the voice of the customer to ensure feedback is heard—and collaborate closely with Onboarding, Customer Success, and Sales to drive timely, thorough issue resolution.

**What you will be doing**

* Solve customer inquiries over email, chat, and phone.
* Manage and coordinate urgent and complicated support issues via our helpdesk


software.

* Log feedback from our customers and partner with product and engineering teams to


ensure customer feedback is heard.

* Partner with our Onboarding, Customer Success, and Sales teams to make sure customer


issues are resolved.

* There may be occasional travel and weekend work required to meet with the team in person and to make sure our customers are supported when necessary.

**What you will bring along**

* At least one year of experience working in a SaaS support role.
* You are obsessed with delivering exceptional customer experience.
* You have a start-up mentality and can thrive in a fast-paced and sometimes ambiguous
* work environment.
* Never satisfied – you are constantly looking to improve both yourself and the business. You are

curious, eager to experiment and try new approaches and tools.

* A history of success in a customer-facing role.
* A desire to learn and immerse yourself in a new industry to truly understand the
* customer. An attitude that gets things done.
* Strong problem-solving abilities to quickly understand customer's core issues and find
* creative solutions.
* An interest in aviation and/or the travel industry is a plus!
* You have a passion for technology and for being a part of a fast-growing SaaS company.
* Able to travel domestically and internationally
* Your English is on a native speaker level (spoken and written)

**Why Avinode Group?**

* We offer you a workplace where we have high engagement and where creativity and curiosity is

always much appreciated - your ideas will be heard.

* We have a remote-first work environment.
* Our Synergy events bring all Noders across departments together in-person to collaborate on a

professional level, as well as have fun which is equally as important.

* We have opportunities to develop your skills or to learn new things with training. We want to

support your development and dreams.

* We’re growth-oriented, entrepreneurial, ambitious and will support you to exceed your goals.
* You will be surrounded by exceptionally talented driven people who are in pursuit of excellence.
* By working together, you will experience your standards, expectations and confidence take a

quantum leap forward.


So don't see this as any ordinary job; you are joining a force to make change and you are at the Core of this!

**Want to join our crew?**


Find more fun facts about our Noders (that’s what we call ourselves) and our culture on our


https://avinodegroup.com/about-us/ website. Kindly apply for this position through the “apply” button


with your CV and cover letter in English as soon as possible. We are not able to accept applications via


email. Please note that selections will be running continuously so don’t wait to apply!

**About Avinode Group**


Avinode Group offers a fully connected suite of essential B2B software to enable Business Aviation


professionals through the entire workflow of managing, sourcing, and booking aircraft. Founded in the


heart of Sweden in 2002, we support around 2,000 companies globally.


Our essential tools are designed to minimize stress and maximize profit for brokers and operators. The


suite includes the world’s leading sourcing platform for air charter, making it easy to find aircraft, book


trips, and market aircraft globally. Air charter operators and flight departments are provided with a fully


cloud-based fleet management system to make flight operations smoother. Our customers can rely on a hassle-free process from quoting to booking and paying with a fully integrated payment solution.


With 150+ Noders spread between Sweden and the US, our flexible and collaborative culture empowers


everyone to come forward with new ideas, try them out, make some mistakes, and initiate dialogue.


Avinode Group seeks candidates who thrive on exciting assignments and can collaboratively work


alongside other intelligent, humorous, and dedicated co-workers. Our roots are firmly planted in our core values, which inspire us daily to exceed expectations. Avinode Group is owned by CAMP Systems, which is the leading provider of aircraft compliance and health management services to the global business aviation industry.


We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment


without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity,


disability or veteran status.


Want more details? Discover the value our essentials bring to our customers every day


https://avinodegroup.com

title: Development Lead
description:
We’re Tacton – a Swedish software company helping the largest manufacturers in the world Configure, Price and send Quotes for their products through our market-leading SaaS tool (ranked #1 by Gartner).


We’re looking for a Tech Lead to join us. In this role, you’ll be one of the most senior members of our development team and play a key part in technical decisions, take technical ownership of projects and systems, ensure high-quality code and development processes, while doing hands-on development every day to help build and improve our product.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Write, review, and maintain clean, well-structured Java code.  


	+ Lead and mentor colleagues by sharing your technical expertise.
	+ Take technical ownership of projects end-to-end, supporting the product development process from concept to delivery.
	+ Collaborate closely with teammates, sharing ideas, giving feedback, and solving problems together.
	+ Contribute to system architecture and help shape the long-term technical vision.
	+ Ensure features work reliably and meet customer needs.
	+ Remove obstacles, keep the team aligned, and ensure timely delivery.

**Skills and Qualifications**


**Required:**

* At least 7 years’ experience in software development, ideally with experience from product development.  


	+ Strong experience with Java or equivalent technology. Interest in working with Java, as that is our core technology.
	+ Experience reviewing code, giving colleagues in development feedback, and making technical decisions.
	+ Experience with taking the lead on technical development initiatives, having responsibility for delivery, and coordinating work with other developers or dev teams.
	+ Ability to help translate high-level requirements into concrete technical solutions.
	+ Good communication skills; able to explain technical concepts to both developers and non-developers.
	+ Fluent in English.
	+ Collaborative mindset, balancing input with openness to alternative approaches

**Preferred:**

* Experience in B2B SaaS product development and cloud technologies.  


	+ Familiarity with test automation and software best practices.

**Why join Tacton?**

* Work on an industry-leading, business-critical SaaS product used by some of the biggest manufacturing companies in the world.
* Influence technical decisions and the future direction of the product.
* Be part of a skilled and experienced Engineering team.
* Hybrid work: Stockholm office, 3 days a week.

**The recruitment process consists of:**

* Screening call with Talent Acquisition
* Logics & personality test (Alva Labs)
* First interview with our hiring manager
* Home assignment & follow-up interview to discuss the solution
* Interview with our CTO
* Reference check

**Our Offer:**


At Tacton, we’ve been building CPQ software for over 20 years. We’re a stable company with global customers and a product that’s central to how manufacturers sell. We offer competitive benefits, flexibility in how we work, and a culture that values learning and collaboration. More:

* **33 days of paid time off** – 30 vacation days plus 3 extra to make sure you get the rest you deserve.
* **Premium occupational pension**
* **Generous wellness allowance** – 5,000 SEK annually to support your health and wellbeing.
* **Private healthcare insurance** – Skip the waiting lines and get quick access to private medical care
* **Parental leave top-up** – We top up your parental leave so you receive up to 90% of your base salary for up to 6 months.
* **Weekly treats** – Fika one week, breakfast the next, because good food brings people together.

**About Tacton**


Tacton is a global SaaS leader in CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote), empowering manufacturers to streamline complex sales processes and drive growth. Headquartered in Stockholm with offices in Chicago, Karlsruhe, and Warsaw, we’re a 220-person team on an exciting growth journey. Recognized by Gartner as a market leader, our technology helps global manufacturers solve real-world configuration challenges and stay competitive in a rapidly changing world.


Learn more at **tacton.com/about**

title: Platform / Cloud Architect – SAP RISE
description:
**Company Description**
 We are a consulting company with a bunch of tech-savvy and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design, and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where every individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, everyone can be themselves while respecting others for who they are. We believe that when an amazing mix of people come together and share their knowledge, experiences, and ideas, we can help our clients on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who can start immediately and wants to grow with us!
   

  

 With us, you have great opportunities to make real progress in your career and the chance to take on significant responsibility.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Drive the platform architecture for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Private Cloud Edition (RISE), ensuring alignment with system integrators, cloud infrastructure, and enterprise standards. Focus on Clean Core, scalability, and upgradeability.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define and own end-to-end RISE platform strategy.
* Collaborate with system integrators to ensure architectural alignment.
* Manage Optional Software Vendors (OSVs) and add-ons to protect Clean Core.
* Document architectures and processes with SAP-style ADRs, HLDs, and diagrams.
* Provide guidance on BTP integration, extensibility, and hyperscaler infrastructure.


 Qualifications
   

  

* 10+ years in SAP Architecture; 1+ full-cycle RISE migration.
* Hands-on experience with S/4HANA Cloud (PCE) and SAP BTP.
* Strong understanding of cloud networking, storage, and security on hyperscalers (Azure/AWS/GCP).
* Proactive, autonomous, with “strong opinion, weakly held” mindset.
* Excellent ability to simplify complex architectures visually.


 Additional Information
   

  

**Start date:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Mode of Work:** 
 Remote
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.
   

  

 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

title: Platform / cloud architect
description:
**Essential requirements:**
* SAP RISE Architecture & PCE: Deep understanding of Private Cloud Edition (PCE) architecture, including the SLA/R&R (Roles and Responsibilities) matrix.
* Platform Strategy & Sizing: Expertise in defining BTP (Business Technology Platform) integration, Side-by-Side extensibility, and sizing for Large Enterprise landscapes (HANA scale-out, memory management).
* OSV & Add-on Governance: Proven ability to manage Optional Software Vendors (OSVs). In RISE, add-ons can break the "Clean Core" or complicate upgrades; this person must know how to vet them technically.
* Hyperscaler Fluency: Since RISE sits on hyperscaler infrastructure (Azure/AWS/GCP), they need to understand cloud networking (VPC peering, Private Link), security, and storage tiers.
* "SAP-Style" Methodology: Proficiency in creating Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) and High-Level Designs (HLD) that align with SAP’s "Enterprise Architecture Framework."
* Visual Communication (VERY IMPORTANT): Ability to translate complex cloud topology into structured, scannable diagrams for stakeholders.
* Process Mapping: Experience documenting the technical cutover and upgrade paths where needed within a RISE context
* Minimum 10+ years in SAP Architecture with at least 1 full-cycle RISE Migration - Mandatory
* Technical S/4HANA Cloud (PCE) + BTP (Business Technology Platform).


**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** 
**when applying.**
**Utilization:** 
 100
 **%**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Period** 
 : 16-02-2026-27-11-2026
   

  

**Last day to apply** 
 : 04-02-2026
   

  

 We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Onsite IT Technician
description:
The world is changing in the way we consume products, from ownership to usership, and DigitalRoute is positioned in the centre of the transition. Because, when enterprises pivot to usage-based business models, they often make an unfortunate discovery. Their systems weren’t built to handle the massive data volumes and complexity that usage-based models generate. This causes them to leak revenue and respond too slowly to customer demand. DigitalRoute solves this by creating a real-time usage data layer for enterprises. Our products transform raw usage data into clear information for billing, in real time and at high scale.
 



  





 This is a hands-on support role with a clear destination: Junior System Administrator within 6–12 months.
 



  





 You'll be the go-to IT person for our Stockholm office while also helping colleagues across our global teams. The work is practical, setting up laptops, troubleshooting access issues, keeping meeting rooms functional, and answering the questions that pop up ten times a day. But there's room to grow into real system administration work: managing Entra ID, Intune, Microsoft 365 admin, and access policies.
 



  





 You'll also get early exposure to how AI is changing IT support, we're actively building and improving an internal AI support bot, and we want someone who's curious about where this is heading.
 



  





 We're a modern SaaS company. You'll work with Windows and macOS, Microsoft 365, Entra ID/AD, Intune, Kandji, Jira, Confluence, and Slack. No legacy nightmares.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Keep people working. Provide L1/L2 support, onsite and remote. Laptops, phones, docks, screens, printers, video conferencing. When something breaks, you fix it. When someone's locked out, you get them back in.
* Set up new joiners. Run IT onboarding. Make sure new hires have working equipment and know how to use our tools from day one.
* Maintain our systems. Help manage Entra ID/AD, Intune, Kandji, and our asset inventory. Create documentation and knowledge base articles. Contribute to our AI support bot (yes, really, we're building one).
* Grow into admin work. As you get comfortable, you'll take on more: Microsoft 365 administration, SSO configuration, access management, device configuration and compliance policies. This isn't a dead-end support gig.



  





**What You'll Bring** 




 Some hands-on IT support experience, service desk, onsite support, internships, or student roles all count. We care more about how you think and communicate than how many years you've logged.
 



  





 You should understand the basics: Entra ID/AD concepts, Windows and macOS, Microsoft 365. You don't need to be an expert.
 



  





 Beyond Technical Skills, We Want Someone Who:
 


* Actually, likes helping people (and stays patient when the same question comes up again)
* Communicates clearly in English, written and spoken
* Stays organised when juggling multiple requests
* Documents their work without being asked
* Is curious about AI and how it's changing IT work. You don't need to be technical, just interested
* Wants to learn and grow



  





 Bonus points if you've used Intune, Kandji, Confluence, Slack, or any asset management/CMDB tools or played around with AI assistants and chatbots.
 



  





**Why join us?** 



* A real growth path with support to get there
* Modern tools, no legacy headaches
* Hands-on experience with AI in a practical IT context
* High visibility in a global, growing company
* A team that actually wants your input on how to do things better



  





 We look forward to receiving your application and a short note about your IT support background and what draws you to this role. We read every application.
 



  





 We follow a continuous selection process, and the position may be filled before the last application date.
 



  





 DigitalRoute is committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse environment, and we actively encourage qualified candidates of all genders, sexual orientations, ethnicities, disabilities, and ages to apply. Join our global and diverse company, where our differences are our strengths.

title: ML/AI Solution Architect
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**




 As a Solution Architect – ML/AI, you will play a central role in bridging business needs with technical implementation. You’ll be responsible for shaping the architectural vision, ensuring alignment with enterprise standards, and guiding teams in building scalable, interoperable ML/AI solutions. Your work will span across multiple product teams and initiatives, where you’ll influence both strategic direction and hands-on delivery.
   

  





 → Define and maintain a shared technical and architectural vision focused on creating alignment across ML/AI solutions.
   

  





 → Translate business and technical requirements into architectural blueprints and ensure alignment with enterprise architecture standards and data governance artifacts.
   

  





 → Collaborate across teams to design scalable, interoperable solutions that meet future customer needs.
   

  





 → Provide leadership and consulting support to product teams, ensuring solutions meet business needs and align with architectural governance.
   

  





 → Develop and maintain architectural documentation, standards, and best practices for ML/AI solutions.
   

  





 → Drive continuous improvements, reduce technical debt, and enhance end-to-end business value.
   

  





**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**




 You’ll be part of the AIAD Solution Architect group within the Data Platform Engineering & Architecture Unit, working cross-functionally with product teams, data scientists, ML engineers, product managers, and other solution architects. You’ll also collaborate closely with the Tech Governance group and the Data and ML Platform to ensure alignment with standards and strategic direction.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE**




*We are looking for people with…*




 → Solid experience in solution architecture within AI and Machine Learning.
   

  





 → Hands-on knowledge of cloud platforms like Google Cloud or Azure.
   

  





 → Strong technical background in data warehousing, analytics, and scalable ML/AI solutions.
   

  





 → Familiarity with architectural frameworks and modeling techniques.
   

  





 → Experience building and validating machine learning and mathematical models.
   

  





 → Understanding of enterprise architecture standards and governance.
   

  





*And people who are…*




 → Analytical and holistic thinkers who see the bigger picture.
   

  





 → Strong collaborators across tech and business teams.
   

  





 → Clear communicators with excellent English skills.
   

  





 → Proactive problem-solvers who drive continuous improvement.
   

  






**Please note that due to the holiday period, application reviews will recommence after January 8th.**





  

  





**WHO WE ARE**




 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**




 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  





 → All our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program (HIP)
   

  

 → All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound
   

  





 → 30 days holiday for H&M-based colleagues
   

  





 → Collective agreement including pension and life insurance
   

  





 → Wellness benefit of 3000 SEK/year
   

  





 → Access to Benify Benefits Portal
   

  





 → Community with activities
   

  





 → 2 half days per month dedicated for Growth Hour and your own up-skilling
   

  





**JOIN US**




 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  





 \*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: IT Consultant - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Stockholm office, we are looking for IT Consultants who will collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international client projects!
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* have a degree in computer science, informatics, business with focus on IT, or a related field
* gathered approx. two years of relevant experience in IT consulting (part or full time)
* are no stranger to the buzzwords machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile, AI, and robotics
* enjoy tackling complex digital challenges and are enthusiastic about developing and sharing solutions
* feel comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts and are flexible and willing to travel
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* Shape the digital future of globally leading companies in an individual client context with overarching technical solutions
* Develop groundbreaking projects by enabling your clients to effectively use agile methods and modern approaches in the context of strategic IT implementation
* Smooth the path for tailored, future-oriented customer journeys based on precise analyses of the individual situation and with current market developments and trends such as machine learning in mind
* Design and optimize unique IT architectures within the framework of enterprise solution requirements, modern custom software developments, and sustainable digital solutions, including cyber resilience


 Additional info
   

  

**How To Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**For a Sustainable Future Together**
 Coop is Sweden's largest cooperative and a leading player in the grocery retail sector, with over 4 million members. We focus heavily on sustainability and work to create a greener and more just future by offering sustainable products and services.
   

  

 We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences is key to creating a more inclusive and successful workplace. Therefore, we welcome everyone, regardless of gender, age, background, or ethnic origin.
   

  

**Join Coop – Together, we make Sweden's food landscape sustainable!**
 Do you want to work with truly massive data volumes, build cutting-edge AI models, and make a real impact in one of Sweden’s largest retail ecosystems?
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are now looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing AI team. You will be part of a small, high-impact unit within a large organization, where your work will be visible, valued, and directly shape how we operate across Sweden. Our focus is on developing AI solutions that help Coop save time and money, improve health, and provide sustainable food for millions of customers.
   

  

 Our environment is fully cloud-based and built for experimentation and large-scale production.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate closely with data engineers/analysts and other scientists, working end-to-end, from defining business problems to deploying models in production and monitoring their impact.
   

  

* Build and deploy advanced ML and AI models that solve real business problems - from demand forecasting and assortment optimization to personalization and logistics.
* Translate business challenges into AI solutions that drive measurable impact.
* Work hands-on with Azure and Spark, handling massive datasets with ease.
* Collaborate closely with data engineers, analysts and business stakeholders - to ensure models are implemented and adopted successfully .
* Contribute to a culture of sharing and learning by exchanging ideas, discussing new research, and improving how we work.
* Communicate insights and technical concepts clearly, adapting your message to both technical and non-technical audiences.


***Who are you?***
 You are a curious and driven Data Scientist who combines strong analytical skills with a genuine desire to turn data into real business impact. With solid experience in the field, you’ve learned how to balance technical depth with practical delivery, and you know when to explore, when to iterate, and when to ship.
   

  

 You thrive in an environment where collaboration and ownership go hand in hand. At Coop, we value people who are humble yet ambitious, who bring ideas to the table, and who believe that progress happens when everyone contributes. You’re a strong communicator and someone who can explain complex concepts clearly, work closely with colleagues across disciplines, and help translate data into decisions that matter.
   

  

**Must Have**
* Proven experience building and deploying machine learning and deep learning models in production
* Strong programming skills in Python
* Experience working in cloud-based environments (e.g. Azure, AWS, or GCP)
* Proficiency with Git and version control in collaborative settings
* Experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch


**Nice to have**
* Experience applying or fine-tuning LLMs for data enrichment, classification, or automation use cases
* Experience deploying models using MLOps principles
* Hands-on experience in Databricks
* Programming skills in Spark
* Exposure to large-scale datasets and distributed computing
* Interest or background in retail, e-commerce, or supply chain analytics


 Fluency in both spoken and written English is required, while proficiency in Swedish is a strong plus.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
 At Coop, you’ll join a company with an enormous amount of data and endless opportunities to innovate. You’ll get the freedom to experiment, the trust to take ownership, and the satisfaction of seeing your work make a difference, from how we serve our customers to how we run our business.
   

  

 We work in a hybrid model where you’ll spend around three days per week at our Solna headquarters.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 If you have questions about this assignment, you are welcome to contact Head of AI & Business Intelligence (Jakob.Liljedahl@coop.se).
   

  

 We will perform interview continuously so please apply in English with your CV, and some words why you feel you’re a good fit for this role at Coop.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
I denna roll får du ett övergripande ansvar för att etablera, drifta och vidareutveckla organisationens centrala övervaknings- och observability-plattform. Arbetet sker i en komplex on-prem-miljö med höga krav på säkerhet, stabilitet och tillgänglighet hos en samhällsviktig aktör.
   

  

 Detta är en hands-on teknisk roll där du är med från start och bygger upp ett helt nytt teknikområde – inte en roll där du sitter och bevakar larm, utan där du formar hur övervakning ska fungera långsiktigt.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden:**
* Etablera Monitoring & Observability som teknikområde från grunden
* Ansvara för drift, förvaltning och vidareutveckling av övervakningsplattformen
* Säkerställa att lösningen är stabil, säker och anpassad för verksamhetens behov
* Sätta struktur för larm, notifieringar, KPI:er och dashboards
* Delta i förändringsarbete, förbättringsinitiativ och teknisk planering
* Vara teknisk rådgivare gentemot applikationsteam och andra IT-funktioner
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av arkitektur- och säkerhetskrav


**Arbetsuppgifter:**
* Installation, konfiguration och vidareutveckling av Grafana-miljöer
* Dashboard-utveckling och onboarding av system och applikationer
* Uppbyggnad av alerts, notifieringsflöden och integrationspunkter
* Prestandaövervakning och analys av flaskhalsar i IT-miljön
* Drift, felsökning och underhåll i Linux-baserade miljöer
* Incident-, problem- och change-hantering
* Automatisering av driftsuppgifter och arbetsflöden (t.ex. Ansible, ServiceNow)
* Dokumentation av lösningar, rutiner och teknisk arkitektur


**Teknik & miljö:**
* Grafana (huvudfokus)
* Linux
* Ansible
* ServiceNow (integrationer och arbetsflöden)
* On-prem miljö
* Miljöer som omfattar Linux, Windows och containeriserade plattformar


**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Erfarenhet av monitorering/observability i komplexa IT-miljöer
* God till mycket god kunskap i Grafana (installation, konfiguration, dashboards)
* Erfarenhet av att sätta upp larm, notifieringar och övervakningsflöden
* Förståelse för prestandaövervakning och felsökning
* Erfarenhet av automatisering, gärna med Ansible
* Vana av incident-, problem- och change-arbete
* Teknisk helhetsförståelse inom IT-drift, infrastruktur och Linux
* Minst några års relevant erfarenhet


**Personliga egenskaper:**
* Trygg i din tekniska kompetens och van att arbeta självständigt
* Strukturerad, analytisk och ansvarstagande
* Engagerad, nyfiken och lösningsorienterad
* Trivs i uppstartsmiljöer och gillar att bygga nytt
* Teamplayer som även är bekväm i en rådgivande roll


**Varför denna roll?**
* Du får bygga upp ett helt nytt teknikområde
* Du får stort inflytande över teknikval, struktur och arbetssätt
* Du arbetar i en miljö med höga krav på säkerhet och kvalitet
* Du får en central roll inom IT-drift och tillgänglighet
* Du arbetar både strategiskt och operativt – brett och djupt


 Tjänsten gäller en långsiktig anställning hos kunden.
   

  

 Är du redo för nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan så återkommer vi med mer information om nästa steg.

title: Solution Architect to Finance, Risk and Compliance – Data Collection | SEB, Stockholm
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.
   

  

 Finance, Risk, and Compliance are undergoing a major transformation—driven by business and regulatory changes as well as significant shifts in architectural design. We are therefore looking for a Senior Solution Architect with Data Warehouse experience to design and implement large-scale data solutions within a highly regulated environment. You will be a vital part of our community driving the Finance, Risk and Compliance agenda in the bank. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, this opportunity is for you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Solution Architect in our team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing large-scale data solutions for financial and risk management.Your work will involve a high degree of complexity, both from a technology and data perspective as well as from a people and process perspective. You’ll work closely with solution and data architects to:
   

  

* Establish the three-layer data warehouse for financial and risk common data, integrating more than 200 source systems on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Ensure compliance with BCBS 239, DORA, and related regulatory traceability requirements.
* Support others in execution of the common data sourcing strategy within own domain.
* Produce architectural designs for initiatives, define solution intent, assess trade-offs, and create comprehensive solution architecture documentation, in line with the business objectives.
* Oversee the implementation of solution architecture, work closely together with tech leads in system design and non-functional requirements.
* Ensure proposed solutions are aligned to the domain architecture.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience of working as a Solution Architect designing and implementing large-scale Data Warehouse solutions in cloud environments, preferably on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Deep understanding of Data Warehouse methodologies and architectures, including Data Vault and Dimensional data modelling, ETL processes, and data integration techniques, as well as experience with performance optimisation and best practices for scalable data solutions.
* Proficiency in using ArchiMate for modeling and documentation.
* Solid knowledge of financial and risk management processes within financial institutions to design solutions that meet regulatory and business requirements.
* Experience driving major transformations, such as cloud migration.
* Proven leadership skills to guide teams, build strong relationships, and foster collaboration.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills to convey complex ideas effectively to both business and IT professionals.
* Fluency in English.


**What We Offer**
* A key role in one of SEB’s most challenging IT/Tech area
* Innovative working environment with highly motivated colleagues
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Do you want to be part of SEB?** 
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 1st of February 2026. If you have questions about the position, please contact Rita Paškevičiūtė, Technology Head of Architecture and Domain Architect FRC to Corporate Functions, by email rita.paskeviciute@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Director, IT Transformation Consulting, Defense
description:
**Director / Senior Director – IT Consulting (Defence Sector)**
**Location: Sweden | Hybrid Work Model**
 Are you a senior leader with deep roots in the Swedish defence or military sector? Have you led strategic technology initiatives, advised top decision-makers, or driven transformation within Försvarsmakten, FMV, FRA, or similar organizations? If you're now curious about how your expertise could shape the future of defense capabilities, Gartner Consulting in the Nordics would like to meet you.
   

  

**Why Gartner Consulting?**
 At Gartner, we help governments and public sector organizations stay ahead of the curve—leveraging technology to deliver real impact. Backed by Gartner’s world-class Business & Technology Insights, our consultants provide independent, data-driven advice that improves citizen outcomes, optimizes taxpayer value, and enhances operational efficiency.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 We’re expanding our Strategy & Technology Consulting team in Stockholm and are looking for a visionary leader with deep defense/military experience.
   

  

 Whether you’ve worked in a consultative role within the Swedish Armed Forces or have led major IT transformations in a defense ministry or agency (internally or representing a consulting firm), your insights are invaluable and we would like to hear from you.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of strategy, technology, and leadership—and is ready to bring that experience into a dynamic, open and inclusive consulting environment.
   

  

 If you feel that you fit some of the criteria (even if not all), we encourage you to get in touch - we are passionate about bringing talent from a wide range of backgrounds.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Advise senior leaders in defense and military organizations on technology strategy and innovation.
* Deliver insights on operating models, organizational design, digital transformation, and governance.
* Support decision-making with data-driven analysis, helping clients optimize IT investments and drive mission success.
* Lead engagements across areas such as cloud transformation, applications modernization, sourcing strategy, and program assurance.


**What We’re Looking For**
 We’re seeking candidates who can operate at the highest strategic level. You may have:
   

  

* Extensive experience in technology-led transformation within the Swedish defense ecosystem (e.g., Försvarsmakten, FMV, FRA, Fortifikationsverket).
* A strong understanding of strategic planning, IT governance, and digital innovation in military contexts.
* Experience in consultative roles—either within a consulting firm or as an internal advisor.
* Familiarity with frameworks for CIO advisory, value realization, and program assurance.
* A relevant academic background (MBA or military equivalent is a plus).
* A passion for shaping the future of defense through technology.


**Why Join Us?**
 This is a unique opportunity to join a world-class consulting team with a proven track record in the defense sector. You’ll work alongside experts who understand the mission-critical nature of defense operations and are committed to delivering meaningful change.
   

  

 Whether you're transitioning from a long career in the armed forces or looking to expand your impact in a new way—Gartner Consulting offers the platform, the people, and the purpose to make it happen.
   

  

**Our Team Culture**
 At Gartner Consulting Nordics, we believe that great work starts with great people. You’ll be part of a team that is anchored in shared values, deep technology expertise, and a strong sense of purpose. We foster a culture of trust, collaboration, and continuous learning—where every voice is valued and every contribution matters.
   

  

 We also believe in flexibility. Our consultants enjoy the freedom to work from wherever they perform best—whether that’s from home, the office, or on-site with clients. What unites us is not where we work, but how we work: with integrity, curiosity, and a commitment to making a difference.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective business and technology insights, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our vast, virtually untapped market potential offers limitless opportunities – opportunities that may not even exist right now – for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:100815
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Platform Engineer - Infrastructure
description:
**TL;DR** 
 We’re looking for an exceptional platform engineer to design and scale the infrastructure behind the future of AI software engineering. You will build and operate the lower part of our stack, making sure that it meets the massive scaling demands of Lovable.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Deep experience building production infrastructure as a Platform Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer or similar.
* You have deep experience with service orchestration, networking, cloud infrastructure and general modern scalable infrastructure practices from a global tech startup or scale-up.
* You have strong programming skills.
* You’re comfortable navigating ambiguity and solving problems as they arise.
* You care about security, stability, and speed and know when to make trade-offs between them.
* You’re based in Stockholm or ready to relocate - this is an on-site, 5-days-a-week role.


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence:** 
 Own and scale the platform that makes AI engineering work for everyone.
   

  

* Design, build and maintain the systems that enable our AI product, such as:
+ A runtime environment for running AI agent workloads in a secure and scalable way.
+ High throughput Sandbox scheduler across multiple cloud providers.

* Harden our infrastructure against failures, downtime, and slowdowns.
* Support our growth, make sure that our infrastructure never becomes a bottleneck.
* Plan and implement our network infrastructure and cloud strategy.
* Identify and drive reliability improvement efforts across all engineering teams.


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love. Lovable platform engineers are capable of working across the whole stack. Examples of tech in our stack include:
   

  

* Frontend: React and Typescript.
* Backend: Golang and Rust.
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Modal.
* Data: Clickhouse, Firestore, Spanner, BigQuery.
* DevOps & Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, OTEL, kubernetes, terraform.


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: SAP Solution Designer
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
* Be a productive member of the team.


 Requirements
   

  

* Analyze incoming interface requirements and align them with established architectural patterns and standards.
* Define, document, and own interface strategies, producing detailed technical specifications supported by functional documentation.
* Collaborate closely with interface owners and stakeholders to collect and validate required inputs (e.g., mappings) and ensure complete, accurate specifications.
* Coordinate with technical delivery teams to review, consolidate, and maintain high-quality interface documentation.
* Support and manage key deliverables, including: Interface Requirement Documents, Functional Interface Specifications, Interface Design Documents, Technical Specifications, Sanity checks of mappings within Functional Specifications, Interface Monitoring Checklists, Error-handling documentation, Interface Catalogues and lifecycle plans, Ongoing maintenance of project repositories and tools (e.g., SAP Solution Manager / Atlas)
* Strong understanding of SAP landscapes and capabilities, including SAP S/4HANA and Clean Core principles (e.g., CDS).
* Proven experience with middleware and integration platforms, such as SAP BTP Integration Suite, BizTalk, Azure, UC4, or equivalent tools.
* Familiarity with technical project management and cross-team coordination in complex integration environments.
* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and patient, with a structured approach to documentation and coordination.
* Adaptable and effective in dynamic, multi-stakeholder project environments.
* Strong communication and presentation skills, capable of engaging both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Proactive in identifying, clarifying, and resolving questions or ambiguities raised by stakeholders.


 Benefits
   

  

* A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Nordisk Team Lead & BDR
description:
**Nordisk Team Lead & BDR**
 Hypergene växer och vi söker en
 **Team Lead & BDR** 
 som både
 **driver egen pipeline** 
 och leder vårt BDR-team. Detta är rollen för dig som trivs i skärningspunkten mellan sälj och marknad— och som vill bygga en funktion som spelar en central roll i vår tillväxt.
   

  

 Du är hälften doer, hälften coach. Du skapar själv kvalificerade möten med CFO:er och Controllers i våra huvudsegement— samtidigt som du leder, säkrar tempo, kvalitet och arbetsmetodik i teamet.
   

  

**Rollen i korthet**
**Du Kombinerar Två Perspektiv**
**Som BDR (50%)**
* Prospektering och kvalificering av nya kunder i våra prioriterade marknader.
* Outbound: research, outreach, cadences och relevanta budskap per vertikal.
* Inbound: snabb uppföljning av MQLer och överlämning till sälj.
* Bygga pipeline av hög kvalitet — möten som konverterar.


**Som Team Lead (50%)**
* Säkerställa ett tydligt arbetssätt, struktur och tempo i teamet.
* Coacha BDR:er i samtalsteknik, kvalificering och prioritering.
* Följa upp KPI:er och pipeline — och driva förbättringar.
* Vara navet mellan Marketing och Sales: feedback, koordinering och kvalitetssäkring.
* Säkerställa datadrivet arbetssätt i Salesforce, Pardot och enligt vår playbook.


**AI som en del av rollen**
 Du använder AI för att höja effektivitet och precision i prospektering, research och outreach. Du coachar teamet i hur AI används smart i vardagen – från datadriven prioritering till bättre outreach. Du identifierar hur AI kan stärka våra processer för kvalificering, lead scoring och pipeline. Du bidrar till att utveckla våra playbooks med AI-stöd, så att teamet jobbar mer effektivt.
   

  

**Vem vi söker**
 Du är en erfaren BDR som har tagit steget vidare till Teamlead. Du gillar ansvar, struktur och att höja kvaliteten i ett team — samtidigt som du fortsatt vill vara operativ. Vi ser gärna att du har tidigare erfarenhet av ledarskap. Det här är en roll baserad på vårt Stockholmskontor.
   

  

**Du Har**
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att leda BDR eller SDR team
* 2–4 års erfarenhet som BDR/SDR, gärna inom B2B SaaS eller komplex försäljning.
* Trygghet i dialog med seniora beslutsfattare (CFO/CEO)
* Erfarenhet av CRM (Salesforce) och moderna outreach-verktyg.
* Tydlig, rak och professionell kommunikation.
* Du skriver och pratar flytande engelska och svenska. En bonus om du pratar fler nordiska språk.


**Du Är**
* Självgående och trygg.
* Strukturerad med hög aktivitetsnivå.
* Datadriven och kvalitetsmedveten.
* Prestigelös och bra på att samarbeta över teamgränser.


**Det viktigaste**
 Du brinner för pipeline och tempo - både i ditt eget arbete och i teamets.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
* Möjligheten att bygga och forma en central del av vår GTM-organisation.
* Ett modernt SaaS-bolag i stark tillväxt med höga ambitioner.
* En roll där du får stor påverkan på vår kommersiella utveckling.
* En kultur som premierar tydlighet, lärande och samarbete.

title: IT Support Specialist (F/M/X)
description:
Who are we?
   

  

**Amaris Consulting** 
 är ett oberoende teknikkonsultföretag som erbjuder vägledning och lösningar till företag. Med mer än 1 000 kunder världen över har vi implementerat lösningar i stora projekt i över ett årtionde – detta möjliggörs av ett internationellt team på 7 600 personer spridda över 5 kontinenter och mer än 60 länder. Våra lösningar fokuserar på fyra olika affärsområden: Informationssystem & Digital, Telekom, Life Sciences och Ingenjörskonst. Vårt fokus är att bygga och ta hand om alla våra teammedlemmar så de kan nå sin fulla potential. Amaris är din språngbräda för att möta förändringen, möta utmaningar och skapa framgång för alla våra gemensamma projekt.
   

  

 På Amaris strävar vi efter att ge våra kandidater den bästa möjliga rekryteringsupplevelsen. Vi gillar att lära känna våra kandidater, utmana dem och kunna ge dem tydlig feedback så snabbt som möjligt. Så här ser vår rekryteringsprocess ut:
   

  

**Kort samtal:** 
 Vår process börjar vanligtvis med ett telefonsamtal för att lära känna dig! Målet? Lär känna dig, förstå dina drivkrafter och se till att vi har rätt jobb för dig!
   

  

**Intervjuer** 
 Vanligtvis är antalet intervjuer 3 - antalet kan variera beroende på den nivå av senioritet som krävs för tjänsten. Under intervjuerna kommer du att träffa personer från vårt team: din närmsta chef förstås, men också andra personer relaterade till din framtida roll. Vi kommer att prata ingående om dig, dina erfarenheter och färdigheter, men också om tjänsten och vad som förväntas av dig. Självklart kommer du också att lära känna Amaris: vår kultur, våra rötter, våra team och dina karriärmöjligheter!
   

  

**Fallstudie:** 
 Beroende på tjänsten kan vi be dig att göra ett test. Detta kan vara rollspel, en teknisk intervju, ett problemlösningsscenario, etc.
   

  

 Som du vet är varje person unik och varje roll i ett företag är också unik. Det är därför vi måste anpassa oss och processen kan variera något ibland. Men vi alltid sätter oss in i kandidatens situation för att säkerställa att ni får den bästa möjliga upplevelsen.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!
   

  

**Job Description**
 Hos oss får du en nyckelroll där du inte bara löser tekniska utmaningar – du gör skillnad för hela campusets vardag. Som IT-supportspecialist på Amaris blir du den självklara kontaktpunkten när teknik och människor möts. Du är den som ser till att allt fungerar, från första inloggningen till den sista presentationen, och du bidrar till att skapa en miljö där innovation och samarbete får ta plats.
   

  

**Grundläggande kunskaper:**
* 3-6 års erfarenhet av IT-support: felsökning av hårdvara och mjukvara, användarhjälp, hantering av användarkonton och behörigheter
* Administration av Windows 10/11 och macOS
* Microsoft 365 backend-administration (SharePoint, Teams, Office suite)
* Active Directory/Azure AD användarhantering
* Nätverksfelsökning (TCP/IP)
* Hantering av utrustning och tillgångar
* Stöd för videokonferenser och mötesteknik
* Efterlevnad av säkerhetspolicyer och ISO-relaterade IT-rutiner


**Personliga egenskaper:**
* Du visar utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och en genuin serviceinriktad inställning
* Du har en naturlig förmåga att knyta kontakter och trivs i en samarbetsinriktad campusmiljö
* Du har en stark självständig arbetsetik och bevisad förmåga att ta ägarskap över komplexa problem
* Du är trygg i rollen som primär IT-kontakt och beslutsfattare för lokala IT-frågor
* Du är öppen, framåt och driven
* Du bor i Stockholm och kan arbeta från kontoret minst 3-4 dagar i veckan
* Du är öppen för resa till andra kontor i och utanför Sverige några gånger i månaden.


**Vad vi erbjuder**
* En internationell community med över 110 olika nationaliteter
* En miljö där förtroende står i centrum: 70% av våra nyckelpersoner började sin resa på första ansvarsnivån
* Ett gediget utbildningssystem via vår interna Academy med över 250 tillgängliga moduler


*Amaris är stolt över att vara en arbetsplats som värdesätter lika möjligheter. Vi arbetar aktivt för att främja mångfald och skapa en inkluderande arbetsmiljö. Därför välkomnar vi ansökningar från alla kvalificerade kandidater oavsett kön, sexuell läggning, etnicitet, religion, ålder, civilstånd, funktionsvariation eller andra egenskaper.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Data Engineer
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm area (hybrid/onsite as agreed)
 



**Team:** 
 Data & Analytics
 



  





**About the Company** 




 We are a fast-growing financial technology company operating in the consumer finance space. Our mission is to simplify financial decision-making through transparency, strong partnerships, and data-driven products.
 



  





 The company is profitable, growing, and entering a new phase where data, analytics, and cloud technology will play a critical role - particularly as the business moves toward more advanced financial services and banking-grade capabilities.
 



  





 You’ll be joining a small, highly professional technology organization with a flat structure, short decision paths, and strong belief in what we’re building.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 We are looking for a
 **hands-on Data Engineer** 
 to help build and scale our modern data platform. This role is central to moving data from legacy on-premise environments to the cloud, structuring data for analytics and reporting, and enabling self-service insights across the business.
 



  





 This is not a pure architecture role. We are looking for someone who enjoys building, migrating, and operating data solutions - working closely with other engineers, and business stakeholders.
 



  





 The data function is growing quickly, and this role offers the opportunity to shape both technical foundations and ways of working.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  





**Data Platform & Pipelines** 



* Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines for ingestion, transformation, and delivery in a cloud environment.
* Support the migration of on-premise data workloads to the cloud.
* Collaborate on platform infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform).
* Ensure data pipelines are reliable, observable, and production-ready.
* Support platform monitoring and operational stability, aligned with financial-grade requirements.



  





**Data Modelling & Data Products** 



* Create well-structured, analytics-friendly data models.
* Harmonise customer and business data into reusable, well-defined data products.
* Work closely with analytics and data science teams to support reporting and advanced use cases.



  





**Self-Service Analytics Enablement** 



* Enable self-service analytics by making curated data available through semantic layers.
* Support BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, or similar (ownership of BI tooling sits on the business side).
* Ensure data definitions are clear, documented, and discoverable.



  





**Collaboration & Growth** 



* Work closely with senior data engineers, data scientists, and platform specialists.
* Contribute to shaping the future data architecture and technical direction.
* Share knowledge, support teammates, and grow with the team as it scales.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




**Technical Experience** 



* Experience building data platforms or pipelines in the cloud.
* Strong preference for Google Cloud Platform (GCP) experience; candidates with AWS (or Azure) experience are also considered.
* Strong SQL skills and experience working with analytical data models.
* Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform or similar).
* Experience with orchestration, transformation, or analytics tooling (e.g. Airflow, dbt, BigQuery, etc.).



  





**Nice to Have** 



* Exposure to messaging or streaming systems (e.g. Pub/Sub, Kafka).
* Experience supporting ML/AI workloads or data products used in production.
* Experience working in regulated environments or financial services.
* Familiarity with BI concepts and tools.



  





**Who You Are** 



* A mid-level to senior data engineer with ~3+ years of hands-on experience.
* Comfortable working in environments where not everything is fully defined yet.
* Motivated by building systems, not just maintaining them.
* Curious, driven, and eager to learn across data engineering, analytics, and platform topics.
* Looking for a long-term role where you can grow with the company rather than being locked into a narrow scope.



  





 This role is ideal for someone who enjoys early-stage platform work, wants meaningful responsibility, and prefers a collaborative, T-shaped team culture over rigid role boundaries.
 



  





**Why Join?** 



* Be part of a major data modernisation journey in a growing fintech environment.
* Work closely with experienced senior engineers and data scientists.
* High impact role with real ownership and visibility.
* Flat organisation, fast decision-making, and a strong sense of shared purpose.
* Opportunity to grow into broader responsibilities as the platform and team evolve.

title: Salesforce CTO - Nordics (Sweden)
description:
Are you ready to make a real impact? Join our Nordic Center of Excellence (COE) for Digital Customer Experience as our Salesforce CTO. As part of one of the top 5 global Salesforce partners, you will play a crucial role in planning and implementing futureproof solutions for and with our clients while being part of our global Salesforce community and CTO Network. This position offers an exceptional opportunity to collaborate and exchange knowledge with a fast-growing community of Salesforce experts.
   

  

**Your role**
*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Shape our place in the market: Build winning proposals and offers backed by innovative solutions, modern delivery approaches, and competitive estimations. Guide CxOs in their decision process to select Salesforce technology and/or Capgemini as their trusted transformation partner within Digital Customer Experience (DCX).
* Ensures our high delivery quality: Shape and participate in design authority and advisory roles across strategic Nordic Salesforce engagements to oversee the realization of proposed target and transition architectures, ensuring long-term scalable and cost-efficient solutions that meet the business objectives of our clients. In this aspect you will also manage own chargeability of 50%.
* Curate and Deploy Salesforce Assets and Accelerators: Promote and position Capgemini’s global offers and accelerators, adapting assets for deployment in the local market or customer context. Ensure that we learn from our successes and failures throughout the community of experts.
* Build that excellent team that our clients deserve: Mentor, activate, and grow the Salesforce architect community within Capgemini Nordics, nurturing future CX architects. Connect with our European and global Salesforce- and architects-community to ensure collaborative growth and thought leadership.


**Your Profile**
* Extensive experience in enterprise architecture and delivery within CX domains, with strong functional and technical knowledge of CRM solutions.
* Salesforce Technical Architecture certification or ambition to achieve it in the near future – which we can help with through our global network.
* Proven track record in leading and mentoring architects and technical teams, with strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
* Experience in crafting scalable CX solutions, leading complex bids, and engaging with CxOs in strategic sales and delivery contexts.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working In This Role**
* A dynamic and a fast-growing Salesforce architect community across the Nordics and globally.
* The opportunity to shape enterprise-scale digital transformations with leading clients.
* A clear path to grow your technical leadership and mentor aspiring architects.


**Application**
 Do not hesitate to submit your application. We will be conducting interviews on a rolling basis and look forward to finding our next colleague!
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be carried out by reviewing your ID card, and background checks may be conducted if necessary.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is an AI-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end-to-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Make it real** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Solution Architect
description:
Are you a dynamic and experienced Solution Architect with a passion for collaborating towards success in a high-tech, innovative environment? Join our forward-thinking Solution Architect team at ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You'll be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Solution Architect**
 You would be responsible for designing and implementing scalable, secure, and reliable solution architectures to address our evolving business needs. This role involves close collaboration with development teams, system architects, vendors, and stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of projects.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Develop end-to-end IoT solution architectures that address current and future business requirements, including data collection from sensors, equipment, and appliances.
* Support the teams in designing and implementing cutting-edge technology solutions that align with ASSA ABLOY's business goals and objectives.
* Assess existing systems and technologies to identify areas for improvement and provide technical expertise and recommendations to stakeholders.
* Monitor emerging technology trends and proactively suggest innovative solutions to enhance our capabilities.
* Conduct technical due diligence to support the M&A team in evaluating potential acquisitions.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least 5 years of relevant experience as a Solution Architect in industrial products, IoT cloud environments, data and analytics architectures, or a similar field.
* Proven expertise in designing and implementing scalable, secure solutions in cloud environments, with hands-on experience in IoT-based wireless technologies such as ZigBee, BLE, and similar protocols.
* A strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) methodologies.
* Good understanding of IT security including cryptography and preferably also PKI infrastructure
* Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with stakeholders and the ability to lead cross-functional teams to deliver projects on time and budget.
* A bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.


 Ideally, you also have relevant certifications in AWS or Azure or have experience in M&A and in the hospitality industry.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a successful career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, please email Alexandra Kymäläinen, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at alexandra.kymalainen@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Professional Galaxy** 
 is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise within IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.
   

  

 Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.
   

  

 Apply today, selection and interviews are ongoing.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We are seeking a
 **Machine Learning Engineer** 
 for our customer in Stockholm.
   

  

**Job description:**

* can code SQL

**Startdatum:** 
 2026-03-02

**Offer continuously:** 
 Please note that for this role we offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested, we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Commercial Account Manager - Sweden
description:
**Account Manager - Sweden**
 Stockholm, Sweden | 750k fixed + 750k OTC = 1.5m OTE
   

  

**Puzzel: The Low-Down** 
**🔍**
 Puzzel is a leading provider of cloud-based contact centre solutions, empowering businesses to deliver exceptional customer service. Our platform combines omnichannel contact centre, workforce management, and AI-driven analytics to optimize customer interactions and operational efficiency.
   

  

 With 25 years’ experience since our foundation in Norway, we’re already #1 in the Nordics, growing rapidly in the UK and expanding into the Netherlands and Finland in 2024, but our ambition is to become the clear European market-leader in the coming years 🚀
   

  

**Why we’re proud**
* 2024 CX Awards Winner, ‘Best Mid-Market Contact Center Platform’
* Puzzel was recognised as the 'most innovative European-founded CCaaS provider' and top 3 globally by Frost & Sullivan in 2023
* Best Practices Company of the Year 2023
* Consistently high Glassdoor rating
* Puzzel places high importance on work-life balance and flexible working hours - as recognised by Flexa, placing 16th overall for work:life balance in 2025!
* We are working with Mercer on salary benchmarking, to ensure pay equality and market competitiveness


**Key Data Points**
* €57m revenue in FY 2024 (up from €50m in 2023)
* Currently ~300 employees
* Used by more than 1100 businesses across 40 countries
* Servicing ~60,000 customer service agents on a daily basis + 800 million customer interactions yearly


**What you'll do** 
**🏡💻**
 We are looking for a hungry and experience Commercial Account Manager to join our Swedish team. We are looking for a ‘hunter’ mentality who can identify and seize opportunities to upsell and cross-sell to our customers, whilst balancing that with an understanding of their situation and needs and knowing when to hold back and nurture the relationship (vs pushing them away).
   

  

* Key Account Management:
* Build and maintain strong relationships with executive decision-makers in your designated list of accounts.
* Manage a portfolio of key Puzzel accounts.
* Understand customers’ strategic challenges and goals and work to ensure Puzzel help them deliver.
* Conduct regular (mostly quarterly and bi-annual) business reviews to discuss performance, goals, and strategic opportunities.
* Collaborate with Customer Success:
* Work closely with the Customer Success department to understand ongoing satisfaction levels and issues which may impact customer satisfaction and willingness to renew or adopt new solutions in the future.
* Renewal Management:
* Track contract renewal dates and initiate renewal discussions well in advance.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure a smooth and successful contract renewal process.
* Ensure clients are moved onto latest MSA and where logical, new packages.
* Ensure customers at renewal are moved onto longer contracts with annual upfront billing.
* Ensure relevant price rises and RPI index are included at renewal to avoid standard inflation coming at Puzzel’s cost.
* Account Growth and Upselling:
* Identify opportunities for cross-selling additional features or services to meet client needs.
* Work closely with the client to expand the usage of existing services.
* Manage churn and downsell effectively through engagement and facilitation of the wider Puzzel team (eg. Customer Success) to ensure clients are satisfied and provide strong NPS results.
* Sales Pipeline Management:
* Maintain a robust pipeline of opportunities for growth within existing accounts.
* Employ upselling and cross-selling strategies across our entire product portfolio.


**The must haves** 
**💪**
* Native level fluency in Swedish
* Proven experience in New Business Sales or Commercial Account Management in the SaaS industry.
* Experience working with a complex SaaS offering.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to analyse data and present insights to clients.
* Proven experience providing excellent client service combined with revenue-oriented awareness.
* Familiarity with CRM software and contact centre technologies.


**The nice to haves** 
**➕➕➕**
* Experience in Contact Centre or CX solutions (CCaaS).
* Managing a multilingual, multi-geography team.
* Experience with / understanding of Nordic business and culture.


**The location**
 This role is located in our Stockholm office at Gustavslundsvägen 145, 167 51 Bromma, Sweden, with expectation of 2-3 days/week in the office.
   

  

**What’s In it for You?** 
**💰**
* Competitive salary with 50% fixed + 50% (uncapped) commission : SEK 750k fixed + 750k OTC = 1.5m OTE
* Flexible, hybrid approach to working; split your time between the office and home
* You get to be part of a fun, driven and supportive team
* Gift on your birthday
* Annual Summer and Christmas parties
* Excellent development opportunities and a great company culture


**Equality and Diversity** 
**🌍**
 We want everyone at Puzzel to be their true, authentic selves at work irrespective of nationality, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical ability, age, or economic background.
   

  

 Whilst we are proud to already have a diverse workforce from across the globe, we are aware that things could always be improved – for example, we currently have a ratio of female 26:74 male employees, which whilst not uncommon for the tech industry (average in SaaS is 26% female), it’s far from ideal. So, what are we doing to improve this?
   

  

* Our Global Leadership Team (C-suite) has shifted from 100% male to 60 male: 40 female in the past 12 months.
* We are partnering with the likes of Flexa, who have significantly higher-than-average talent pools of candidates from diverse backgrounds.
* We are working with State Employment initiatives in Norway and Sweden to bring candidates through internship/apprenticeship routes and are investigating similar initiatives in the UK and Bulgaria.
